title: Information-Theory Interpretation of the Skip-Gram Negative-Sampling Objective Function
venue: Proceedings of the 55th Annual Meeting of the Association for Computational Linguistics (Volume 2: Short Papers)
abstract: In this paper we define a measure of dependency between two random variables, based on the Jensen-Shannon (JS) divergence between their joint distribution and the product of their marginal distributions. Then, we show that word2vecâ€™s skip-gram with negative sampling embedding algorithm finds the optimal low-dimensional approximation of this JS dependency measure between the words and their contexts. The gap between the optimal score and the low-dimensional approximation is demonstrated on a standard text corpus.
